meta.description: Candidate-controlled landing page that enables employers to evaluate reasoning, learning, and fit through investigation rather than filtering.

requirements.title: Reproducible development environment initializes successfully
requirements.description: Set up a reproducible development environment that can be installed and run from a clean checkout.
acceptance_criteria: Repository installs dependencies using a single documented command
A development server can be started locally
A production build command exists and completes successfully
README documents install, dev, build, and test commands
All commands succeed on a clean machine
verification: Run install command from clean checkout
Run dev server command and verify process starts
Run build command and verify successful exit

requirements.title: Test harness is configured and runs in CI
requirements.description: Establish a minimal automated test setup to verify future features.
acceptance_criteria: A test runner is configured
At least one test file exists
Tests can be run via a single command
Tests run as part of CI or a local equivalent
Test command exits successfully
verification: Run test command locally
Verify at least one passing test
Verify test command fails if assertion is broken

requirements.title: Landing page renders with evaluation-focused framing
requirements.description: Create a minimal landing page that frames the site as an evaluation surface rather than a resume or portfolio.
acceptance_criteria: Root route renders without errors
Page includes a clear positioning statement about evaluation
Language avoids resume-style claims
Page content is static and deterministic
Page is covered by at least one automated test
verification: Start dev server and load root route
Run test suite and verify landing page test passes

requirements.title: Exploration path is visible on landing page
requirements.description: Provide visible entry points that invite investigation, even if underlying features are placeholders.
acceptance_criteria: Landing page includes at least two exploration CTAs
CTAs clearly describe future interaction (e.g. 'Ask how I work', 'Check role fit')
CTA targets are valid routes or placeholders
Routes render without runtime errors
Routes are covered by minimal tests
verification: Navigate to CTA routes
Run test suite verifying route rendering

requirements.title: Canonical experience data model exists and is validated
requirements.description: Introduce a structured, typed representation of personal experiences that serves as the single source of truth for future UI rendering and AI grounding.
acceptance_criteria: A canonical experience data model is defined in code (e.g. TypeScript interfaces or schema)
The model captures: context, constraints, decisions, outcomes, and lessons learned
At least the three existing experiences are represented using this model
Experience data is stored in a deterministic, version-controlled format (e.g. TS/JSON)
The model is imported successfully by application code without runtime errors
The data model is explicitly documented in code comments or README
The data model can be extended without breaking existing consumers
verification: Typecheck succeeds with the new model
Application builds successfully after adding the model
At least one automated test validates the structure or contents of the experience data
Breaking the model shape causes tests or typecheck to fail

requirements.title: Read-only Experience Explorer renders canonical experience data
requirements.description: Expose the canonical experience data model through a read-only UI that allows employers to explore context, constraints, decisions, outcomes, and lessons learned.
acceptance_criteria: A new route exists for exploring experiences (e.g. /experience or /experiences)
The UI renders experiences exclusively from the canonical experience data model
At least one experience can be selected and viewed in detail
The detail view displays context, constraints, decisions, outcomes, and lessons learned
Navigation between experiences is possible without page reloads
The UI is deterministic and contains no AI-generated content
The implementation introduces no breaking changes to existing routes
All rendered content avoids resume-style claims and marketing language
verification: Navigate to the experience explorer route and view each experience
Verify that rendered content matches the canonical data model exactly
Run test suite and confirm new UI tests pass
Break experience data shape and confirm tests or typecheck fail

requirements.title: Explicit strengths and gaps matrix is visible and trustworthy
requirements.description: Provide a clear, honest, static matrix of strengths and gaps that helps employers quickly assess alignment and avoid mismatched roles.
acceptance_criteria: A new route exists for viewing strengths and gaps (e.g. /strengths or /fit-overview)
Strengths are grouped into at least three categories (e.g. Strong, Developing, Not my strength)
Each listed item uses clear, plain language without buzzwords or marketing claims
Items are grounded in evidence from the canonical experience data model
Gaps are explicitly stated and not softened with hedging language
The matrix is static and deterministic (no AI-generated content)
Language emphasizes fit and alignment, not self-promotion
The page renders without errors and integrates with existing routing
verification: Navigate to the strengths and gaps route and verify all categories render
Confirm that listed strengths and gaps align with experience data
Run test suite and verify page rendering is covered by automated tests
Break referenced experience data and confirm tests or typecheck fail

requirements.title: Manual fit evaluation tool provides honest alignment assessment
requirements.description: Provide a deterministic, non-AI fit evaluation tool that helps employers assess alignment based on role characteristics and clearly explains where fit is strong, partial, or weak.
acceptance_criteria: A new route exists for fit evaluation (e.g. /fit-evaluation)
The page presents a small set of structured inputs describing the role (e.g. role type, domain, team context)
Inputs are limited and intentional (no free-text job descriptions)
Submitting the form produces a deterministic fit result
Possible outcomes include at least: Strong fit, Partial fit, Not a fit
Each outcome includes a clear explanation grounded in strengths and gaps data
The tool explicitly advises against proceeding when fit is weak
No AI or probabilistic logic is used
Language emphasizes mutual time-saving and alignment, not persuasion
verification: Navigate to the fit evaluation route and complete the form with different inputs
Verify that identical inputs always produce identical results
Verify that explanations reference strengths and gaps accurately
Run test suite and confirm fit logic is covered by automated tests
Break fit logic mapping and confirm tests fail

requirements.title: Grounded AI query interface enables experience interrogation
requirements.description: Introduce a constrained AI-powered query interface that allows employers to ask questions about experiences, decisions, strengths, gaps, and fit logic, grounded strictly in canonical data.
acceptance_criteria: The existing /ask route is upgraded to an AI-powered query interface
The AI is grounded exclusively in canonical experience data, strengths/gaps data, and fit logic
The AI explicitly refuses to answer questions outside its grounding context
Responses prioritize explanation of reasoning, decisions, and tradeoffs over summaries
The AI can acknowledge gaps or uncertainty when data is insufficient
The interface supports multi-turn follow-up questions
The AI does not generate new claims, achievements, or metrics
Language remains calm, factual, and non-promotional
verification: Ask questions about each experience and verify answers match canonical data
Ask a question outside scope and verify the AI refuses appropriately
Ask follow-up questions and verify consistency across turns
Run test suite including prompt or response snapshot tests
Disable AI or break grounding input and verify tests fail

requirements.title: Experience data is synchronized with updated reference and system integrity is preserved
requirements.description: Update canonical experience data to reflect changes in experience_reference.md and ensure all dependent systems remain correct, consistent, and fully verified.
acceptance_criteria: Canonical experience data files are updated to reflect the latest experience_reference.md
All experience fields (context, constraints, decisions, outcomes, lessons learned, signals) accurately match the updated reference
No stale or removed experiences remain in the data registry
Any new experiences in the reference are added as separate, properly structured data files
Experience IDs remain stable for existing experiences unless explicitly deprecated
Strengths and gaps evidence references are updated to match the new experience set
Fit evaluation explanations remain accurate given updated experience data
Query engine responses reflect updated experience content without hallucination or mismatch
verification: Run full test suite and confirm all existing tests pass
Add or update tests to validate new or modified experiences
Verify experience explorer renders all updated experiences correctly
Verify strengths and gaps matrix references valid experience IDs
Submit representative queries to the query engine and confirm responses align with updated experience data
Intentionally introduce a mismatch between reference and data and confirm tests fail

requirements.title: Guided evaluation flow orients employers and accelerates fit decisions
requirements.description: Introduce a lightweight narrative and sequencing layer that helps employers understand where to start, how to explore, and when they have enough information to decide.
acceptance_criteria: The landing page presents a clear recommended evaluation path with an estimated time cost (e.g. '2â€“5 minutes to decide fit')
Each primary section (Experiences, Strengths, Fit, Ask) includes a short orientation explaining what questions it answers
Orientation copy explicitly states when a section is sufficient to stop exploring
Experiences page includes guidance on how to choose which experiences to read (not all are required)
Strengths and gaps page explains how it should influence a hiring decision
Fit evaluation page explains when its output should override further exploration
Ask page explains what kinds of questions it can and cannot answer
Cross-links between sections are intentional and directional (e.g. 'If this concerns you, check X next')
Language remains neutral, factual, and non-promotional
No new business logic, data models, or AI behavior is introduced
verification: Follow the recommended evaluation path end-to-end and confirm it leads to a clear decision point
Verify that each section includes explicit 'what this tells you' or 'when to stop' guidance
Confirm existing functionality and logic remain unchanged
Run test suite and verify orientation content is covered by UI tests

requirements.title: Capability discovery interface is deployed and publicly accessible
requirements.description: Prepare and deploy the application so it can be shared with external reviewers without caveats or setup friction.
acceptance_criteria: Application is deployed to a public URL
Production build runs without errors
Routing works correctly on page refresh
All primary routes are accessible directly via URL
README includes deployment URL and brief usage instructions
No development-only warnings or placeholders are visible
Build and test pipeline remains unchanged and passing
verification: Visit deployed URL and navigate through full evaluation flow
Refresh on nested routes and confirm no 404s
Run CI pipeline and confirm green status
Share URL with a non-technical user and confirm basic usability

requirements.title: Readability-first layout and typography improvements
requirements.description: Improve text readability and scanning comfort across the site without introducing branding, marketing visuals, or new interaction patterns.
acceptance_criteria: All primary content is constrained to a readable max-width and centered
Line length does not exceed comfortable reading limits on large screens
Base font size and line height are increased for long-form reading
A neutral system font stack is used (no custom or branded fonts)
Clear visual hierarchy is established using spacing and headings, not color
Primary CTAs remain visually discoverable without appearing sales-oriented
No animations, illustrations, gradients, or decorative elements are added
No new components, routes, or business logic are introduced
All existing content, copy, and behavior remain unchanged
verification: Visually inspect all major routes on desktop viewport (Landing, Experiences, Strengths, Fit Evaluation, Ask)
Confirm text does not span full screen width on large displays
Verify long sections are comfortable to read without horizontal scanning
Run full test suite and confirm no regressions
Confirm no snapshot or UI tests fail due to content changes

requirements.title: Reduce content density and improve scanability on landing page
requirements.description: Refine layout and content presentation to reduce cognitive load and improve scanability, without changing tone, meaning, or introducing visual branding.
acceptance_criteria: Primary sections on the landing page are visually distinct through spacing and structure, not color or decoration
Long paragraphs are broken into shorter paragraphs or lists where appropriate, without changing wording meaning
Key guidance sections (Recommended Evaluation Path, When to Stop) are visually emphasized through layout hierarchy
The evaluation path steps are easy to scan individually and do not require linear reading
The page can be meaningfully skimmed in under 30 seconds
No new copy is added beyond minimal structural helpers (e.g. labels, short lead-in lines)
Tone remains neutral, factual, and non-persuasive
No animations, illustrations, icons, or branding elements are introduced
No new routes, components, or business logic are added
verification: Visually inspect landing page on desktop viewport and confirm clear separation of conceptual sections
Verify that key guidance sections are immediately noticeable without scrolling excessively
Confirm that a reader can understand the intended evaluation flow by skimming headings and lists only
Run full test suite and confirm no regressions
Confirm all existing UI and snapshot tests pass without semantic changes

requirements.title: Centralize all user-facing copy into a single reference file
requirements.description: Collect all user-facing text content into a single plain-text or markdown file to support tone review, iteration, and external feedback.
acceptance_criteria: All user-facing text from the application is extracted into a single file (e.g. copy.md or copy.txt)
Content is grouped by page or section (Landing, Experiences, Strengths, Fit, Ask)
Each section preserves the exact wording currently used in the UI
No wording is changed as part of this task
File clearly indicates where each text block appears in the UI
No new logic, routes, or UI changes are introduced
verification: Manually compare UI text against reference file to confirm completeness
Confirm that all major pages are represented
Run full test suite to ensure no regressions
Confirm that application behavior and rendering are unchanged

requirements.title: Modularize user-facing copy into single-source-of-truth files
requirements.description: Refactor user-facing text into centralized, page-scoped copy modules to make tone iteration and wording changes easy, safe, and reviewable over time.
acceptance_criteria: All user-facing copy is moved out of JSX and into dedicated copy modules
Each primary page has a corresponding copy file (landing, experiences, strengths, fit, ask)
Copy modules export plain strings or simple structured objects only (no logic, no functions)
UI components import copy explicitly from their corresponding copy modules
No copy is duplicated across files
Existing wording is preserved exactly as-is during this refactor
The centralized copy structure makes it possible to change wording by editing a single file per page
copy.md remains as a human-review artifact and is not used as a runtime source
verification: Manually verify that all visible text in the UI originates from copy modules
Search codebase to confirm no user-facing strings remain hardcoded in components
Run full test suite and confirm no regressions
Confirm application behavior and rendering are unchanged

requirements.title: Rewrite landing page copy to be reader-centric and exploratory
requirements.description: Rewrite the landing page copy to sound natural, calm, and hiring-manager centric, framing the page as a project record available for inspection rather than a guided evaluation or self-presentation.
acceptance_criteria: Landing page title is updated to use a neutral, non-promotional framing (e.g. 'Project Record' or equivalent)
Primary framing avoids first-person narration where possible and does not center the author as the speaker
Language is exploratory and descriptive rather than directive or imperative
No phrases instruct the reader what to do (e.g. 'stop here', 'check', 'proceed', 'start with')
Evaluation affordances are presented as available views or angles, not as a recommended path
Tone is calm, factual, and human; avoids abstract system language (e.g. 'interface', 'capability discovery')
No new sections, routes, or features are introduced
Meaning and intent of existing content are preserved; only wording and framing change
Updated copy remains consistent with the overall workplan principles
verification: Manually review landing page copy to confirm absence of imperative or patronizing language
Confirm landing page reads naturally when read aloud
Verify no other pages were modified
Run full test suite and confirm no regressions
Confirm copy changes are reflected in copy.md
